definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: He finished his speech with the same slogan.
sentences.chinese: 他以同樣的口號結束了他的演講。

sentences.english: Its catchword is " the wife that invites beauty is more beautiful " .
sentences.chinese: 它的口號是“讓漂亮的女人更動人”。

sentences.english: I will not shout any slogan, but only hoping that the Earth (should) remain beautiful as long as it can be!
sentences.chinese: 口號就不呼了，只希望，只希望地球能永遠這麼美。

sentences.english: Does the president actually think in these tough-guy slogans?
sentences.chinese: 總統的思維方式真的就像硬漢們的口號嗎？

sentences.english: The slogan of Harmonious Society has strong flavors in Confucianism and Socialism.
sentences.chinese: 和諧社會的口號和儒教及社會主義相當對味。

sentences.english: This is the education of America's classic slogan.
sentences.chinese: 這是美國人最精典的教育口號。

sentences.english: Use this panel to change port numbers.
sentences.chinese: 用這個頁面來改變端口號。

sentences.english: Someone suggested "Power to the Manager" as a FreeKick slogan.
sentences.chinese: 有人提出“權力的管理”作爲一個任意的口號。

sentences.english: I think their slogan is "Keeping Britain British".
sentences.chinese: 我想它的口號是“讓英國保持英國風”。

sentences.english: President Bush's remarks were disrupted several times by shouting protesters.
sentences.chinese: 布希總統的講話幾次被高喊口號的抗議者打斷。

sentences.english: "No muss, no fuss" is a great slogan to remember.
sentences.chinese: “沒有弄亂，無事”是一個偉大的口號記住。

sentences.english: Don't always say the catchwords and slogans that are not real.
sentences.chinese: 虛的口號或標語不要常掛嘴上。

sentences.english: Organizations also use taglines to brand themselves and their family of products.
sentences.chinese: 公司也會用口號宣傳自己的品牌和產品。

sentences.english: Catchword , it is the one big characteristic in life of my party politics.
sentences.chinese: 口號，是我黨政治生活中的一大特色。

definition: to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
Taiwan independence/(of Taiwan) to declare independence
to fight against/to oppose/to be opposed to/opposition
DPP (Democratic Progressive Party, Taiwan)/abbr. for 民主進步黨|民主进步党
